page.title: 11DISCUSSION WITH FARMER
page.content: MR BURGESS HAS BEEN A FARMER ON "BANDON" FARM FOR ALMOST 30 YEARS. WHEN HE FIRST CAME TO THIS NORTHERN PART OF GLENROTHES, THERE WERE NO HOUSES, AND FARMS WERE DOMINANT IN THE AREA. MR BURGESS SAID THAT IN THOSE DAYS HIS FARM WAS TAKEN UP WITH LIVESTOCK AND VARIOUS CROPS INCLUDING WHEAT, BARLEY AND CATTLE FODDER. NOWADAYS HE SAYS THAT WITH GLENROTHES EXPANDING NORTHWARDS HE HAS LOST SOME LAND BUT HAS RECIEVED COMPENSATION FROM THE GLENROTHES DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION. MR BURGESS NOW HAS NO LIVESTOCK EXCEPT FOR A SMALL NUMBER OF POULTRY. HE STILL GROWS BARLEY AND POTATOES. MR BURGESS THEN SAID THAT 100 YEARS AGO THIS PART OF GLENROTHES WAS COVERED IN WOODLAND AND THEN WHEN HE FIRST CAME TO THE AREA FARMS BECAME THE DOMINANT FACTOR.
